verses.roman:
purāṇa-saṁhitām etām
ṛṣir nārāyaṇo 'vyayaḥ
nāradāya purā prāha
kṛṣṇa-dvaipāyanāya saḥ

synonyms: purāṇa—of all the Purāṇas; saṁhitām—the essential compendium; etām—this; ṛṣiḥ—the great sage; nārāyaṇaḥ—Lord Nara-Nārāyaṇa; avyayaḥ—the infallible; nāradāya—to Nārada Muni; purā—previously; prāha—spoke; kṛṣṇa-dvaipāyanāya—to Kṛṣṇa Dvaipāyana Vedavyāsa; saḥ—he, Nārada.
translation: Long ago this essential anthology of all the Purāṇas was spoken by the infallible Lord Nara-Nārāyaṇa Ṛṣi to Nārada, who then repeated it to Kṛṣṇa Dvaipāyana Vedavyāsa.
